author: Tom Reed
title: Plutus Certification Program
description: Companies looking for developers to help with building smart contacts won't know if the developer know what they are doing.

assessments.note: Of course, the idea itself is quite interesting. As we have more developers that work in Cardano networks, they also need to have certain knowledge with Plutus, Haskel, Marlowe, etc. And certification is one way to acknowledge their skills.
The proposal does address the challenge quite clearly in text, but the funding level and degree of detail is not there.

The proposal and proposer has not provided bona fides in terms of Plutus expertise to justify the provisioning of a certification program. Details of any kind are lacking to progress the proposal to the next step.
The problem statement and solution described are reasonable, but there is no way to efficiently assess whether the proposal will address the challenge, as no plan has been described.

Although a certification program would incentivize developer education, the proposal does not provide any specifics about what a certification would entail and how that would specifically enhance the developer ecosystem.

Very underdeveloped idea/concept presently. I don't believe this is an actual proposal meant for funding. It needs more work so that it can explain in greater detail how it fits within the mission brief and goals of this challenge. It isn't really much to work with to understand it better.

The proposer plan is not detailed enough. Or even not yet refined or finalized at all. It's still vague. Maybe the proposer could try to make the project planning first, with mockup or some website, where the voter could see how does the proposer vision the end result of the project.
No information is provided by the submitter

The proposal lacks any detailed plan in terms of the delivery of a Plutus certification, the curriculum from which an award could be granted nor any steps to establish the foundation of a program. The proposal could be improved by itemising deliverables such as, but not limited to; mode of delivery of the testing, a committee to oversee adherence to Plutus standards and quality, etc.

There is no plan outlined in the proposal. The proposer described 25 years of experience as a software developer, but there are no details on his professional experiences and skills. I recommend the inclusion of a plan and details about the qualification of the proposer and that the proposal be created based on the Catalyst documentation.

The proposer does not detail any expertise in developing certification programs and the proposal does not outline how such a certification program would be developed and deployed. It is also silent on the adoption risk for such a program.

Not an actual proposal that we can work with in its present shape/form. First, make sure to add experience in such a way that we can verify/validate the claims. Professional links, profiles, past references. Also - when asking for a budget - and if it asks for such a big part of the fund - we need to understand how you plan to spend it. Breaking it down so ti fits your plan. These elements are must down the line. Please, consider adding them.
I don't think the proposer could finish this project. No project planning, no schedule, no KPI. And it requires USD 400,000 (quite big fund).
No information is provided by the submitter

In the bigger picture, a Plutus certification program would be required in the future and will be beneficial to developers who attain mastery of the language; to establish credibility in seeking Cardano opportunities and/or to build in the ecosystem, much like any certification exists right now for other programming languages. However this proposal is at a very nascent stage, more an idea than a proposal with a clear path to delivery.

There is not enough information to check the feasibility, in addition the proposal is requesting a budget of $ 400,000 dollars, which is the full amount of the challenge. I recommend that the proposal be rewritten based on the Catalyst guidelines and documentation.
The proposal lacks a justification of its budget, a roadmap, and specific KPIs.

There are no elements of roadmap, milestones, success metrics, KPIs, challenges/risks mentioned, or other things which could help us examine the proposal. It needs a lot more work. I suggest seeking mentorship on catalyst discord that could potentially help. If you are serious about getting funded.

solution: Create a certification program around the entire smart contact / Plutus system.
experience: I've been a software developer for over 25 years.
